text: Rudolf Gelbard (4 December 1930 â€“ 24 October 2018) was an Austrian Holocaust survivor and political campaigner. He fought against anti-Semitism and neo- Nazism. He taught in schools and universities about his experiences during the Holocaust. From 1954-1963, Gelbard worked for the Ministry of Social Affairs. He later worked as a merchant, before becoming editor of the Kurier in 1975. Gelbard died in Vienna on 24 October 2018 at the age of 87. ==References== Category:1930 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Holocaust survivors Category:Austrian activists Category:Austrian businesspeople Category:People from Vienna
